File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_GithChokepoint_CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.lsj
Synopsis:
Cinematic: Kith'rak Voss flies away on his dragon. The player interrupted the Gith Chokepoint situation. The most likely interruption is triggering a combat (player attacks any npc there including Voss or the dragon, or drags another hostile npc near them) This interruption happens in gameplay, so normally the Rider (Kith'rak Voss) and the Dragon would also leave in gameplay, but animations don't have the tech support to make the Rider ride the dragon like this, so we play this cutscene instead

null
uid: a3435fc0-77d6-51e5-9f17-a92901abf2bf
Cinematic: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away. NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.
=== END NODE ===

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_GithChokepoint_Confrontation.lsj
Synopsis:
Our party encounters a band of githyanki warriors who have taken position at bottleneck in the region - a bridge that provides one of the few paths of progression. The gith confront us and try to see if we know anything about the 'weapon' they seek. (The weapon in question is the strange puzzle box we are carrying.) While reading our thoughts, the githyanki may realise we are tadpoled, resulting in instant combat. If we manage to conceal our tadpoles, they may allow us to pass.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_GithChokepoint_ConfrontationLaezel.lsj
Synopsis:
Alternate version of the dragon rider scene at chokepoint. Lae'zel is alive and was never recruited. Player can recruit her after this. Lae'zel approaches the rider to discover where to find the creche. A cure for the tadpole can be found there - or so she believes. However, the knight is under different orders.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_GithChokepoint_ReadingMap.lsj
Synopsis:
|Item interaction: player clicks on the githyanki map and tries to read it. Githyanki are able to read it. Lae'zel is added in the 3th speaker slot. Any others are in the second slot. If Lae'zel is taking the map from somebody, they are both speakers in the dialog. Otherwise the second or third slot are null.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_HarperSkeleton_PAD.lsj
Synopsis:
This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across a pair of old skeletons with harper and druid equipment. A successful history skill check will reveal these two were probably part of the Harper/druid alliance that fought against Ketheric's army of Shar. If the player has seen the frescos in the Druid's Circle of the Den depicting the battle between the Sharran troops and the Harpers/Druids, they will automatically jump to the 'Success' node.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_KarlachRecruitment_Karlach.lsj
Synopsis:
First meeting with Karlach, future Origin/Companion. She's a fugitive, wounded and hiding from cultists who are hunting for her to drag her back to hell. The dialogue begins with a stream separating the player and Karlach, as she points a crossbow at them when they approach, holding them at bay. She's fierce, defiant, and intense. But friendly and grateful if the player helps. Shouldn't be too angry - she's in a bad situation and doesn't know who to trust, but she's also been in far worse situations. She has a sense of humour about her predicatment, no matter how bad it gets.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_StuckHalfElf.lsj
Synopsis:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had. When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him. The barbarian class will have advantage in a strength check to lift the wreckage off Benryn, however if they fail, they can try again with a higher DC. Failure the second time will lead to more debris collapsing and killing Benryn.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_StuckHalfElf_Freed.lsj
Synopsis:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had. When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_StuckHalfElf_TryJoinParty.lsj
Synopsis:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had. When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.

Synopsis:
The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the drow raiders. He was killed by a Flaming Fist archer perched atop the inn.

Synopsis:
The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a member of the Flaming Fist who was sworn to protect the Duke. She was among the final Fists left standing. She was killed guarding the Duke.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_Tavern_OxAlive.lsj
Synopsis:
An agitated ox, trapped in a stable near a burning inn. The inn was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. Players may try to calm him - if they fail, he attack. In his SwA version, he speaks like a human. He is initially in a state of terrified rage, barely able to form sentences. If he's pacified, he is calm and placid. The ox is standing in a stall, a dead goblin at his feet. When players arrive, he is agitated, ready to attack at a moment's notice. If calmed, he will relax and moo peacefully.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_ZhentDungeon_DoubtingArtist.lsj
Synopsis:
An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar is being forced to paint against his will. He'll discreetly approach the player and beg them to buy him, mindful that he's within earshot of his brutal captors. If he is freed by whatever means, he'll regain some of his old haughtiness but will ultimately still be grateful as he relates his story - that he's torn between two loves. The first is the patron who has offered to marry him, and the second is a first true love from his pre-fame and -wealth past.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_ZhentDungeon_Zhent03.lsj
Synopsis:
Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.

Synopsis:
One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_Tollhouse_PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.lsj
Synopsis:
Reflection dialog that plays after discovering that the paladins hunting Karlach made a deal with the arch-devil Zariel. The party reflects on whether these people deserve to be punished for dealing with a devil, or whether we should help them. Speaker 1 has agreed to help them. Speaker 2 comments on th is decision. Karlach cannot take part in this dialog.

0:0 - We slay Karlach, and we save these souls from eternal damnation. Justice will be served.
1:0 - We may have more important pursuits - but when it comes to slaying the Hells' minions, I'll find the time.
2:0 - I had really hoped we were above base pursuits like 'monster hunting'.
3:0 - I hope this proves to be worthwhile. We can hardly afford distractions.
4:0 - Who's to say who's the real villain in this tale of devils and masquerades?
5:0 - The truth is, if there is a devil running wild, we might have to deal with it one way or another.
uid: d628960c-fc12-4ec4-9694-d55a62988217
- 0:0 Tag: Custom - |Really Generic origin| (An enthusiastic adventurer of remarkable spirit and mettle.)
=== END NODE ===

0:0 - We slay Karlach, and we save these souls from eternal damnation. Justice will be served.
1:0 - They made the wrong deal, but they got themselves into that mess. They can get themselves out.
2:0 - You're not actually intending to waste time hunting this Karlach person, are you?
3:0 - We may have more important pursuits - but when it comes to slaying the Hells' minions, I'll find the time.
4:0 - I have to say I don't know if agreeing to this hunt was such a wise idea.
5:0 - Are we really going to hunt a devil on their behalf?
uid: f3fdfd99-4dfb-4cca-b2fc-ea277e221fe3
- 0:0 Tag: Custom - |Really Generic origin| (An enthusiastic adventurer of remarkable spirit and mettle.)
> We slay Karlach, and we save these souls from eternal damnation. Justice will be served. We may have more important pursuits - but when it comes to slaying the Hells' minions, I'll find the time. I had really hoped we were above base pursuits like 'monster hunting'. I hope this proves to be worthwhile. We can hardly afford distractions. Who's to say who's the real villain in this tale of devils and masquerades? The truth is, if there is a devil running wild, we might have to deal with it one way or another.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_PreciousCargo_PAD.lsj
Synopsis:
This PAD was converted from a RD where the party were discussing what to do with a valuable chest they've found. It triggers when agents are not nearby and a character picks up the chest or tries to open it, or deals with the agents and then notices the chest in the cave.

0:0 - Zarys' chest? I bet it holds all sorts of treasures.
1:0 - Zarys was looking for this chest. Whatever it holds must be valuable.
2:0 - They did not want to part with that chest. And their boss promised good coin if it stays locked.
3:0 - Zarys was looking for this chest. Surely there's something valuable inside.



4:0 - Zarys' treasure. Must be something good.



5:0 - Looks like Zarys' missing shipment. It must be hiding quite the treasure.
6:0 - The chest's clearly worth a lot to the Zhentarim, if it's returned unopened.
uid: 11d1fe2b-a00b-06a9-3c3c-490d16609b4f
- 0:0 Tag: Custom - |Really Generic origin| (An enthusiastic adventurer of remarkable spirit and mettle.)
- 0 Check flag(s) (Global):
   true - PLA_ZhentDungeon_Quest_AgentsMissing - PLA_ZhentDungeon_Knows_AgentsMissingdescription
- 1 Check flag(s) (Script):
   true - This flag template was not found somehow... -
> We could always return it. Or maybe... Well, I see no reason to return it. Let's see what's inside. Yes, but why tell us not to open it unless there's something very good inside? Whatever's inside belongs to us now. May as well crack it open, right? Only one way to find out. Unless we plan to ask the Zhentarim for a shipping manifest. It's our chest now. We can do whatever we want with it.

0:0 - Hm - but it does raise a question: what if its contents are more valuable than the reward?
1:0 - Is her reward more precious than the contents of the chest? Doubtable.
2:0 - She was very clear that we shouldn't open it... but what if we did, though?
3:0 - She'll pay handsomely for its safe return... but what's inside that she cares about so much?

4:0 - But maybe it's worth more than the prize money, right?
5:0 - Let's hope our fee isn't worth less than its contents.
6:0 - Yes, but who knows what's inside? It could be worth more than any purse she'll offer.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_KarlachRecruitment_Karlach_PostEA.lsj
Synopsis:
First meeting with Karlach, future Origin/Companion. She's a fugitive, wounded and hiding from cultists who are hunting for her to drag her back to hell. The dialogue begins with a stream separating the player and Karlach, as she points a crossbow at them when they approach, holding them at bay. She's fierce, defiant, and intense. But friendly and grateful if the player helps. Shouldn't be too angry - she's in a bad situation and doesn't know who to trust, but she's also been in far worse situations. She has a sense of humour about her predicatment, no matter how bad it gets.

=== END NODE ===

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_ConflictedFlind_Flind.lsj
Synopsis:
The flind is the leader of a pack of gnolls. Normally, these monsters hunger for flesh and eat anything, but the flind has been infected with a mind flayer's tadpole (like the players) and this has created an internal 'Voice' that guides it toward certain meat, forbidding others. The forbidden meats are those that work for the mind flayers - including the players - leading to a telepathic 'dialogue' when the flind restrains itself from attacking and calls off its pack. We can attempt to overpower the Flind psionically, allowing us to control it temporarily in order to destroy the pack of gnolls. If we choose to fight the Flind, we should be prepared for a difficult encounter. It is strong, though far from the most powerful of its kind thanks to the war raging in its brain.

Synopsis:
A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night. Once inside, they set about trying to clear rubble to reach someone trapped within.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_FlamingFist4.lsj
Synopsis:
This dialogue can happen in two phases: while pushing agianst rubble outside of the inn, or in a more generic setting (either searching the inn or clearing rubble). A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

0:0 - We have to get them out!

=== END NODE ===

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_FlamingFist3_AD_Working.lsj
Synopsis:
A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night. Once inside, they set about trying to clear rubble to reach someone trapped within.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_FlamingFist2.lsj
Synopsis:
This dialogue can happen in two phases: while pushing agianst rubble outside of the inn, or in a more generic setting (either searching the inn or clearing rubble). A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on her way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

Synopsis:
A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night. Once inside, they set about trying to clear rubble to reach someone trapped within.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_EscapingZhentarim.lsj
Synopsis:
Salazon is preparing a fire-trap at the entrance to his gang's hideout. We can either sneak up on him or be sneaked up on in turn - either way we have to convince him we should be there or he'll get skittish and blow us all up. In general he's jumpy and suspicious of us, but relieved when we convince him we're a friend. Think an inexperienced guard pointing a gun at us when he's been told to be on alert.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Plains\PLA_DyingHyena_VB_PostFight_3P.lsj
Synopsis:
Three players have just finished a fight with gnolls. Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas.

0:0 - No wonder, if they're leaping from hyenas left and right.
1:0 - They spread quickly - the whole coast will be infested if we don't burn them out.
2:0 - Is there no corner of this plane they don't infest?
3:0 - Vile beasts. Nothing good is born from a corpse.
4:0 - They do have a way of popping up when least expected.
5:0 - I had no idea this was their mating season.
6:0 - It won't be hard to keep their scent. That foul blood is everywhere.
7:0 - Not a good sign that they're bursting to life everywhere.
uid: 0d8b17b1-50a3-c7fc-617f-dc50b7b27ef3
